name: Land use change
functionStatement: Runoff and infiltration sustain natural flow regime, carry appropriate sediment and nutrients from uplands, and reliably cue spawning/migration of aquatic life.
descriptionMarkdown: <5% land cover shift in ~15-20 years, indicating stable infiltration/runoff consistent with historical conditions.
howToMeasureMarkdown: Compare land cover between two time periods (for example NLCD 2001 vs 2019) and compute percent area converted to a different major class.

levels.label: Optimal
levels.criteriaMarkdown: <5% new development or clearing, or only minor land cover shifts.

levels.label: Suboptimal
levels.criteriaMarkdown: 5-15% converted from one major land use to another.

levels.label: Marginal
levels.criteriaMarkdown: 15-30% converted with likely effects on infiltration or flow patterns.

levels.label: Poor
levels.criteriaMarkdown: >30% converted. Drastic alteration in runoff, infiltration, and habitat.

references: NLCD Land Cover (MRLC), for example 2001 vs 2019
